Package com.example.qr_quest

Class QR

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.example.qr_quest.QR
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Serializable
    public class QR
extends Object
implements Serializable
    QR class represents a QR code and stores its content, hash value, score, and avatar. It also provides methods to generate hash value, score the QR code, and create an avatar from its hash value. Additionally, it provides methods to set and get location, caption, and image string of the QR code.
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

    • Constructor Detail

      • QR

        QR()

      • QR

        public QR​(String content)
        Constructs a new QR object with the given content. It generates the hash value, scores the QR code, and creates an avatar from the hash value.
        Parameters:
        content - The content of the QR code

    • Method Detail

      • generateHashValue

        private void generateHashValue​(String string)
        Generates the hash value of the given string using SHA-256 algorithm and UTF-8 encoding.
        Parameters:
        string - The string to be hashed

      • scoreQR

        private void scoreQR​(String qrHashValue)
        Scores the QR code based on its hash value. The score is calculated by XOR-ing the decimal value of each character with the count of consecutive same characters, raised to the power of the count minus one.
        Parameters:
        qrHashValue - The hash value of the QR code

      • createAvatar

        private void createAvatar​(String qrHashValue)
        Creates an avatar from the hash value of the QR code.
        Parameters:
        qrHashValue - The hash value of the QR code

      • getScore

        public Long getScore()
        Returns the score of the QR code. The score is calculated by XOR-ing the decimal value of each character with the count of consecutive same characters, raised to the power of the count minus one.
        Returns:
        the score of the QR code
